required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 13, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of Co-Administration of ABT-493 and ABT-530 With and Without RBV in Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Genotype 2 or Genotype 3 Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of Co-Administration of ABT-493 and ABT-530 With and Without RBV in Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Genotype 2 or Genotype 3 Infection (SURVEYOR-II)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ABT-493 and ABT-530 coadministered with and without ribavirin in adults with HCV genotype 2 or genotype 3 infection.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects who achieve 12-week sustained virologic response (SVR12) in each treatment arm
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid less than the lower limit of quantification

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects who achieve 4-week sustained virologic response (SVR4) in each treatment arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid less than the lower limit of quantification

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with virologic failure during treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with quantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid at the end of treatment with at least 6 weeks of treatment, confirmed quantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid after previously having unquantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid, or a confirmed increase of at least one log10 in hepatitis C

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with Post-Treatment relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with confirmed quantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid among subjects with unquantifiable hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid at the end of treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: - Male or female between 18 and 70 years of age, inclusive, at time of Screening
- Screening laboratory result indicating HCV Genotype 2 or 3 infection.
- Chronic HCV infection.
- Subject must be either HCV treatment-naïve or treatment-experienced.
- Subject must be documented as non-cirrhotic or as having compensated cirrhosis. Exclusion Criteria: - History of severe, life-threatening or other significant sensitivity to any drug.
- Female who is pregnant, planning to become pregnant during the study, or breastfeeding; or male whose partner is pregnant or planning to become pregnant during the study.
- Recent (within 6 months prior to study drug administration) history of drug or alcohol abuse that could preclude adherence to the protocol in the opinion of the investigator.
- Positive test result at Screening for hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) or anti-human immunodeficiency virus antibody (HIV Ab).
- HCV genotype performed during screening indicating co-infection with more than one HCV genotype.
